dc:title: The Meaning of Poverty
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Explains the misconceptions of those who see voluntary poverty as destitution and the absence of beauty and order. Discusses the different places where poverty exists and urges a personal response as the solution, rather than a state solution. Uses scripture as the basis for her personalist argument.
